Copy¶

copy¶

copy [OPTIONS] [INPUT_PATHS]...

Options

-o, --output_path <output_path>¶
-c, --channels <channels>¶

List of channels, all channels when ommited.

-s, --slicing <slicing>¶

Dataset slice (TZYX), e.g. [0:5] (first five stacks) [:,0:100] (cropping in z)

-st, --store <store>¶

Zarr store: ‘dir’, ‘ndir’, or ‘zip’

Default

dir

-z, --codec <codec>¶

Compression codec: zstd for ’, ‘blosclz’, ‘lz4’, ‘lz4hc’, ‘zlib’ or ‘snappy’

Default

zstd

-l, --clevel <clevel>¶

Compression level

Default

3

-w, --overwrite¶

Forces overwrite of target

Default

False

-zl, --zerolevel <zerolevel>¶

‘zero-level’ i.e. the pixel values in the restoration (to be substracted)

Default

0

-wk, --workers <workers>¶

Number of worker threads to spawn. Negative numbers n correspond to: number_of _cores / |n|

Default

-4

-wkb, --workersbackend <workersbackend>¶

What backend to spawn workers with, can be ‘loky’ (multi-process) or ‘threading’ (multi-thread)

Default

threading

-ck, --check <check>¶

Checking integrity of written file.

Default

True

Arguments

INPUT_PATHS¶

Optional argument(s)
